examples.text: the vocal organs *(= the tongue, lips, etc.)*

definitions.definition: telling people your opinions or protesting about something loudly and with confidence

examples.text: He has been very vocal in his criticism of the government's policy.
The protesters are a small but vocal minority.
criticized by a small but increasingly vocal minority
women who are very vocal about men's failings

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin vocalis, from vox, voc-. Current senses of the noun date from the 1920s.
